Context:
George Brown College offers more than 160 career-focused certificate, diploma, postgraduate and degree programs. International Students can find support from the International Student Services, which includes answers to questions on applications, housing, permits, scholarships, and connecting with an International Student Advisor. The Virtual Service Desk is open Tuesday to Thursday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. and Fridays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. for current students. Services offered include support with application processes, staying informed about college news and events, and land acknowledgment. However, immigration advising cannot be provided via the Virtual Service Desk. The contact information for International Student Services is: phone number - 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, email - ask.george@georgebrown.ca.

Services Requirements: International Students should note that they cannot receive immigration advising from the Virtual Service Desk and must contact their International Student Advisor instead. They can also sign up to be kept informed about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more by signing up on the website.
